meanings.definition: A device that produces an illusion of motion from a rapid succession of static images.
meanings.sent1: The zoetrope displayed a horse running when spun quickly.
meanings.sent2: I watched a zoetrope at the museum that showed a dancing figure.
meanings.sent3: The zoetrope at the fair made me feel like I was in a magical world.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a zoetrope, with events flashing by in quick succession.
meanings.sent5: The zoetrope's images seemed to come alive, dancing before my eyes.

meanings.definition: To create the illusion of motion using a zoetrope.
meanings.sent1: She decided to zoetrope her drawings to see them move.
meanings.sent2: We can zoetrope the pictures to make them look animated.
meanings.sent3: He loves to zoetrope his sketches to bring them to life.
meanings.sent4: The artist will zoetrope the frames to make the animation smoother.
meanings.sent5: They will zoetrope the scenes to add a dynamic element to the film.
